definition[0]: the process of gradually destroying your enemy or making them weak by attacking them continuously
definition[1]: when people leave a company or course of study and are not replaced
example[1]: Staff reductions could be achieved through attrition and early retirements.
definition[2]: the process of reducing the number of employees by not replacing those who leave for normal reasons, such as changing jobs, RETIREMENT (=leaving a job when you reach a certain age) etc
example[2]: The bank plans to reduce its staff by as much as 5% this year by natural attrition.
definition[3]: when customers are lost, for example because they start buying a competitorâ€™s product
example[3]: The success of this credit card has contributed to the attrition of card holders from other issuers.
